page.title: 14The Use of The Forest
page.content: The forest in our area is one of outstanding natural beauty and there are many demands made upon it by the farmer and tourist. Part of the forest is used for grazing by New Forest ponies and the area around Hursthill Inclosure is designated a Nature Reserve. There is public access to the forest at Gritnam Wood, Clayhill Heath and Whitley Wood off the Brockenhurst Road. At these sites there are car parking facilities, picnic sites and many miles of paths and trails for people to enjoy the natural, peaceful surroundings. Dogs are forbidden at most of these sites. The public are reminded to take their litter home. Guided walks through the forest are organized by The Forestry Commission and leave Lyndhurst on selected dates in summer months, price 25 pence.
